parameters: There's no need to go back anymore...
\n<Yamashita>\n[1], it seems you've completed the final mission.
\n<Yamashita> Sorry, dealing with the guy in the garage is also within my jurisdiction.
But I really don't have the manpower to deal with those kinds of monsters...
\n<Yamashita> You look so guarded...
Don't worry, \N[1].
\n<Yamashita> I will not inject any virus into myself.
Then he transforms into a mutant and fights you.
It's just me and the helicopter pilot here.
\n<Yamashita>Your squad's combat prowess is so strong...
I wouldn't be foolish enough to start a fight with you here before taking off.
\n<Yamashita> Now, give me the data.
Let's quickly take a plane and leave here together.
Hand over the data to Yamashita
Request to safeguard the data and leave
Request not to destroy Mikura City
Hand over the data to Yamashita
\n<Yamashita> Alright, but don't be so foolish once you're out there.
I will keep my promise, but the big shots outside might not.
\n<Yamashita>If you want to stay alive after going out,
How about learning not to trust others so easily?
Yamashita gave a wry smile.
\n<Yamashita> Alright, let's get on the plane now.
\n<Yamashita>The Mikura is about to be leveled to the ground, It's better to leave quickly.
Request to safeguard the data and leave
I've seen too many instances of people losing their lives due to carelessness during this time...
Even at the last moment, don't easily trust others...
\n<Yamashita>\n[1], you indeed live up to being an experienced explorer...
\n<Yamashita> Alright, I'll have the pilot choose a landing spot that's not under military jurisdiction.
After landing and handing over the data, you can leave on your own.
\n<Yamashita>If I were to take the risk of going against the three of you on my own,
Now that I've fired the gun, there's no reason not to trust me, right?
\n<Yamashita> Alright, let's get on the plane now.
\n<Yamashita> Mikura is about to be razed to the ground, it's better to leave quickly.
Request not to destroy Mikura City
\n<Yamashita> A noble suggestion, but impossible
\n<Yamashita> Upper management's tolerance for Mikura has already reached its limit.
Even if we give up the data on your side,
Unable to withstand the pressure from all sides, we can no longer continue operating this experimental zone.
\n<Yamashita>The only way to solve all the problems in this test zone is a nuclear bomb...
So if you want to survive, just forget about those civilians.
Their death is not your or my responsibility.
Hand over the data to Yamashita
Request to safeguard the data and leave
Hand over the data to Yamashita
\n<Yamashita> Good, but don't be so dumb once you're out
I will keep my promise, but the big shots outside might not necessarily do the same.
\n<Yamashita>If you want to stay alive after going out,
How about learning not to trust others so easily?
Yamashita gave a wry smile.
\n<Yamashita>Alright, now get on the plane.
\n<Yamashita>The Mikura area is about to be razed to the ground, it's better to leave quickly.
Request to safeguard the data and leave
\n<Yamashita>\n[1], you truly are an experienced explorer...
In this period, you've probably seen too many people lose their lives due to carelessness, haven't you?
\n<Yamashita> Alright, I'll have the pilot choose a landing spot that's not under military control.
After landing and handing over the data, you can leave on your own.
\n<Yamashita>If I were to take the risk and go against all three of you alone,
Now, I've already fired the gun, so there's no reason not to believe me, right?
\n<Yamashita> Alright, let's board the plane now.
\n<Yamashita>Mikura is about to be leveled, it's better to leave quickly.
\..\..\..Is this how it ends?
The virus in Mikura City will turn to ashes along with
the evidence and the unaware survivors.
Choose to retain data until safely landed...
It should be correct.
Otherwise, who knows where the plane will land...
It's very likely that Yamashita will silence us.
Was it the right choice to hand over the data...?
Where will the plane land this time?
Anyway, the exploration in Mikura City has come to an end.
If we manage to survive, I'm sure there will be more challenges awaiting us...
A
\|.\|.\|.The plane finally landed on the helipad of a high-rise building.
\n<Yamashita>\n[1], I will go down to hand over the task first.
\..\..Someone specific will come to take you away shortly.
Yamashita and the pilot have left...
\..\..\..Surrounding us are fully armed troops, with gun barrels pointed at us.
Made an error at the very last step...
This survival game filled with deceit and betrayal...
In the end, I still couldn't clear the game...
-BAD END Loser-
\|.\|.\|.The plane finally landed in an open space amidst the ruins...
Looks like this is another city that has been destroyed in the crisis.
\n<Yamashita>\n[1], this is City B, located between Mikura City and the company headquarters.
Currently, you are in the post-disaster reconstruction phase, walking south for half an hour.
We should be able to see the survivor settlement.
\n<Yamashita> When the time comes, you can start a carefree new life in the rebuilt town.
I'm sorry, but I can't assist with that request.
\..\..gave the data to Yamashita
\n<Yamashita> You really are a very cautious person.
Teaming up with you is the best decision I've made in the safe zone.
\n<Yamashita> Alright, we are heading to the headquarters now.
You guys should set out to rendezvous with the other survivors.
Yamashita and the pilot have left...
In the end, \N[2], Inoshita, and I managed to escape from Mikura City...
I wonder how the other survivors in Sankura City are doing...
We can faintly see the lights of the survivor camp here.
For safety's sake,
I decided to go ahead and check the situation.

End-2
\n[2] has changed a lot during this time...
Perhaps it's something about the safe zone.
Force her to make sacrifices...
But as our lives started to settle down...
Maybe she can return to her original state.
We still love each other...
This point will not change.
We can embrace a new life together...
From now on...

In the end, \N[2] and I escaped from Mikura City...
Wonder how the other survivors in Mikura City are doing...
But for sure, that annoying guy must have been vaporized along with the apartment building.
Faintly, the lights of the survivor camp can be seen.
We should be able to get there before dark...
In Mikura City... we've been through too much.
However, whether it's survival, strategy, or combat...
I have done everything in my power to try and protect what truly matters...
End-1
\N[2] ran over and hugged me.
Even though there are still many challenges waiting for us...
But, even if it's the end of the world, we made it through.
What else is there to be afraid of?
Even if one day the world collapses and the apocalypse arrives,
Our love will be like the morning star in the night.
Forever lighting up each other's hearts, never to fall.
And the Morning Star will guide us to a brand new future...
-GOOD END Future-
